preqs: ESC2111 and ESC2122, or by permission from the Head of School

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ESC2111, ESC2122}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ESC2111, ESC2122}

unitName: Igneous and metamorphic processes and geochemistry
description: This unit covers material on the petrology and geochemistry of the Earth's mantle and crust, their melting to generate silicate magmas and the emplacement of these magmas in and on the crust; also the basics of trace element and isotope geochemistry applied to the understanding of these processes. Metamorphic petrology extends the geochemical and petrological principles to understanding the formation of metamorphic rocks and using those rocks to elucidate processes in the Earth's crust.
